root.name: sub()
root.description: Subtracts x, y, and z components from a vector, subtracts one vector from another, or subtracts two independent vectors. The version of the method that substracts two vectors is a static method and returns a PVector, the others have no return value -- they act directly on the vector. See the examples for more context.
root.syntax: vec.sub(x, y, z) vec.sub(v) PVector.sub(v1, v2)

parameter.label: x
parameter.description: float: the x component of the vector

parameter.label: y
parameter.description: float: the y component of the vector

parameter.label: z
parameter.description: float: the z component of the vector

parameter.label: v
parameter.description: PVector: the x, y, and z components of a PVector object

parameter.label: v1
parameter.description: PVector: the x, y, and z components of a PVector object

parameter.label: v2
parameter.description: PVector: the x, y, and z components of a PVector object
